website_summaries.verdict: Kensington resurrects a dying breed with the SlimBlade Trackball, but the potential of its unique shortcut buttons devolves into a mess of clumsy extra functions and awkward movements that restrict productivity.
pros: Comfortable for those physically unable to use a standard mouse
heads-up display conveniently shows the current mode
cons: Toggling between three modes complicates work flow
can't customize buttons or alter trackball sensitivity

customer_reviews.title: Best there is.
customer_reviews.text: I like the relatively flat design, less likely to cause wrist problems than Kensington's other, taller/steeper big trackballs that I've enjoyed for decades. The scrolling feature without the physical ring is new -- it takes a short time to get used to, and works fine. Update 4/21/2020: Earlier I complained that the software had problems, that the Slow Pointer and Single Axis Movement feature didn't work. KensingtonWorks software update to version 2.1.16 fixed those. It all works now. Excellent trackball -- the best! By the way, I;m using it on the latest Mac OS Catalina (10.15.4) and the latest KensingtonWorks (2.1.16).
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: design needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: Coming from the cheaper Orbit Trackball with scroll ring i have to say that this product in comparison looks good but does not function as well. The problem is that the large left and right click buttons take up almost 50% of the surface area and are way too easy to click. Need more resistance on the buttons or reduced button size. I found that while scrolling around directories in windows explorer an accidental left click would cause a folder or file to be dragged and dropped into another folder. Frustrating. It took me about 15 minutes of use before I had to return this item.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Carroll Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Can't turn off ball scrolling
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like the trackball. I even like the feature where you rotate the ball left and right to scroll up and down. I don't like that you can not disable the scrolling entirely when needed. I.E. I am working on a series of PowerPoint presentations and the scrolling happens. This causes the current slide to change versus just moving the mouse left or right. It should be an option in the software to disable it. The software allows for profiles by applications, but you can only lower the scrolling effect versus having it disabled.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the easiest install process on my MacBook Pro running Mojave
customer_reviews.text: I've used Kensington trackballs for years and they do exactly what they're supposed to do. Apple is making it hard to integrate other hardware into their setups and this is an example. In order to get the trackball to work, I have to first disconnect the trackball from the USB interface, turn off that interface, restart the computer, then turn on the power to the USB interface and then, finally and only finally, insert the Trackball's USB connector into the USB interface. Once you get used to the process it's not so bad, but it is just one more thing to remember. Do anything out of sequence and the Mac won't recognize the trackball. Just a little tedious.....
customer_reviews.author: P. Gleeson

customer_reviews.title: Very cool but not precise enough
customer_reviews.text: This thing looks and feels like the future. I loved using it. It worked great for casual web surfing and getting around but when it came time to use Photoshop or Illustrator, it just wasn't precise enough. It's a little too wild for precision graphic design software. If I was a normal guy using the internet, though, I would love to use this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good trackball
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for about a month now, and it's a fairly dependable decent trackball. The rollerball itself is huge, which is nice for control. The scrolling ring works well, too. I like the device's low profile, which works great for carpal tunnel. My only complaint is that it seems to get dirty very quickly, then stop scrolling. I'm finding myself cleaning the ball and the housing almost every day to keep it clean and working, which is strange because I'm not using it with dirty hands or anything. That's my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: John F.D. Taff

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Buuuutttt......
customer_reviews.text: I love the design. It is so much better than the pad. The only problem is that I could not get the software to detect the SlimBlade so, alas, I can neither customize nor make use of the other two buttons. Tech support suggested not using a USB hub, to connect directly into my MacBook Pro, but that means not being connected to my MIDI controller or my interface, which defeats the whole purpose of using the SlimBlade to edit audio. It wasn't detected when connected directly, anyway, but at least I get the advantage of not needing desk space to move a mouse around.
customer_reviews.author: Denver C. Risley

customer_reviews.title: Essential eurgonomic tool
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a Kensington pro or slim trackball for about 20 years! I've had a three and my upgrades were for features not due to any issues with the track ball. Recently the support was great when navigating an issue with a MAC OS update, so thought I'd add a review here. I've bought a slimblade for both my children as a preventive measure, both have been using it for over 5 years. The only update I'd like to see is for the slimblade to be wireless, but its a minor thing considering all the benefits of this excellent product. Great design, smooth operation, adjustable settings - can't live without it.
customer_reviews.author: jmshopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent track ball device
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to diss those who don't like this device, a pointing device is very individual. But as for me, I've had three Kensington track balls in the past, one gave out on me and was replaced. I still have one and they all worked reasonably well. I also have a Rollermouse Red, which is my work device and is excellent. But this thing is far superior to the other Kensington trackballs I've had, it has a smoother operation and feels much more accurate. Once I got used to the scroll it became great to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great product!! No issues. Ball is smooth while using. I love the twist feature using the ball to scroll up and down the page. Buttons stick a little at first but "breaks-in" after a few weeks. I'm glad I bought this instead of other four-button black one. However, my forearm muscles do tighten-up after awhile due to not resting my hand. Then at night I massage my forearm and it loosens everything back-up. I may buy a pad to rest the bottom of my forearm so it doesn't get so tense. Need-less to say - this is way better than a mouse or a thumb-trackball. I use this track-ball and have it side-by-side with a CST-2545-5W-RC.
customer_reviews.author: Janette

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and Functional
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse, can't believe I did without it for so long. I used the expert mouse for 10 years at my old workplace then went without for about 2 years... I finally decided to purchase the slimblade and OMG I am so glad i did! Once you get over the learning curve (Don't give up) you will wonder how you ever did without. You will need a mouse pad for the slimblade, only because you might click the leftclick button while using the trackball, I got one at the 99 cents store. Although the expert mouse and the slimblade are old products, there is absolutely no reason they should be updated. They are perfect, beautiful, functional trackball/mice.
customer_reviews.author: chris manriquez

customer_reviews.title: feels good in hand, software does not work.
customer_reviews.text: The trackball is smooth and feels good in the hand. I have gone to help twice and can not get the software to work. It runs me around in circles or does not see the track ball. So I can't control the speed of the ball and it is a two button trackball. I would give it 5 stars if the software worked. OSX 10.13.6
customer_reviews.author: tom f

customer_reviews.title: Solid mouse alternative
customer_reviews.text: I have used trackballs in the past, but ended up going back to regular mice due to rest of family. I have been using the Slimeblade for the past month and will not be going back. I got one for work, home, and another in my computer travel bag. It is comfortable, solid, and reduces stress on my wrists. I use it for productivity - office apps, browsing, and general use. I do not see this working for gaming and can be a little challenging at time to get to the precise spot to adjust columns. However, as someone who spends a lot of time in front of the computer, I am more comfortable with the track all.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent for Arcade type gaming !
customer_reviews.text: I got this specifically to play Millipede; the classic Atari game. This works excellent and on my Windows 10 computer, it was truly plug in, wait half a minute for it to be recognized and install whatever it needed then I "just" double clicked on my "Arcade Classic" icon and the track ball was recognized and simply worked. I do want to find a way to slow down the ball response; unless thats considered cheating ?
customer_reviews.author: Cust8e0

customer_reviews.title: Best One Yet!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this design. I had been using their (much clunkier) 4-button trackball for a really long time, but was ready for a sleeker design. This fit the bill, but installing the trackballworks software on my O.S. was truly awful. It took me banging on support for well over a year before the engineers got to 1st level support for a solution, and it's very cumbersome to perform. In fact, it was crazy. They should have parameters we can use in the Run command to get that thing installed from the Downloads folder; not what we ended up doing, which was to pick it apart from the temp folder, and install it from my Desktop. Insane!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this trackball and when i plugged in the trackball didnt work. Called Kensington and they told me its defective. So i returned it and got a replacement. Plugged it in and the arrow started jumping and sliding randomly across the screen without me even touching the trackball. Called Kensington again and they told me that its probably defective again. Just submitted my request for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Arun

customer_reviews.title: Great when arthritis flares
customer_reviews.text: The ergonomics are excellent when my arthritis flares. The ability to use thumb for left click and other fingers for other functions is very helpful. Using the ball to scroll up or down makes scrolling much easier. Had an older version of the Keningston trackball and improvements on this model are significant.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Farji

customer_reviews.title: Returned for replacement
customer_reviews.text: The ball was extremely stiff, difficult to move despite tweeking with the Kensington software app. The replacement promptly sent by Amazon works perfectly. I love the ball mechanism which allows precision for graphic design.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: r u selling inventory items!?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a trackball two years ago. The version of the trackball was "Reg.1.09". But the trackball version we just bought is "Reg.1.00". So I can not enter two keys at the same time. I hope you understand what happened.
customer_reviews.author: Client d'Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Definate Upgrade Over Expert Mouse
customer_reviews.text: If you have been a user of the Kensington Expert Mouse you will be very comfortable with the Slimblade Trackball. The laser tracking is smooth as butter and a huge upgrade from the old style potentiometer wheels. The Slimblade is one of the few products I have purchased recently that I can honestly say not only met but exceeded my expectations. Some users may prefer a more familiar thumbwheel for scrolling and may find twisting the ball less desirable, I also expect that serious gamers might prefer some programmable buttons, for my use the Slimblade is power steering.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good improvement over a mouse, but far to go
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Scrolling, cursor movement, easy cleaning Cons: Breaks quickly, feels cheap, bad wrist position, bad software Its better than the Elecom Huge, because of the smooth bearings, but its difficult to click the buttons, and ergonomics wasn't a priority with this design. The fact it hasn't been updated in ten years means this is what we're stuck with.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous1

customer_reviews.title: Nice for my arthritic hands....
customer_reviews.text: Because of arthritis and a displaced tendon in the index finger knuckle, I needed an alternative solution to the typical mouse. Tried a track pad, but have never been a fan of those. My occupational recommended a track ball, I hadn't remembered that these we still made. This was a great solution. I also needed a slim unit because of the configuration of my desk key board tray, so it all worked well. Can't compare to other products, but I would agree with the other comments that this might stress the wrist. I have no problems scrolling with the ball.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Required more work to adapt to than I was willing to do
customer_reviews.text: I like the size, and it is smooth and provides good control. The scroll feature is a little odd at first, but I think I would get used to that. My problem is that I found myself holding one or more fingers up a lot of the time (compared to letting them rest on a mouse.) This became painful after an hour or two. I expect that I would adapt to this over time, but I was not willing to wait and see. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: BBB

customer_reviews.title: HUGe improvement over the standard Kensington expert
customer_reviews.text: I work at a computer all day. I’ve developed bad tendonitis. I’ve used the Kensington expert for years and recently decided to try the slim blade out. I was skeptical that it would be an improvement, but it is an astonishing improvement over the expert! The scroll function, turning the ball, is easier on my arms than the scroll wheel on the expert (a few reviews said otherwise). I’m never going back to my expert.
customer_reviews.author: Sequoical

customer_reviews.title: Feels nice.  DOESN’t work as advertised.  Tech support is horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Trackball Works, the driver advertised to customize this device, and the 2 hours of unsuccessful tech support from Kensington are a complete disaster. This company could not have found a better way to screw up the support for this device if they tried. DON’T BUY THIS TRACK BALL EXPECTING TO BE ABLE TO USE ALL OF ITS FEATURES!! RETURNING!
customer_reviews.author: E. Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best trackball ever made.
customer_reviews.text: It's simply the best trackball I've ever used. I do graphic design and love programming the buttons to do different functions in my design software. I program one button to hide all of my pallettes in Illustrator/Photoshop so I can get them out of my way quickly and have the whole screen. Then, when I need them, I hit the button and they all pop back up. The scroll takes a little to get used to but once you get it set the way you want it is awesome as well.
customer_reviews.author: William Lorentz

customer_reviews.title: Was sent Unit with old revision. Chording doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the SlimBlade for years and just ordered and received my third one after the previous one started having problems. I was shocked when I realized the chording feature didn't work and was not even available within the TrackballWorks software. I then look a little closer in the help menu and see that I was sent a Revision 1.00 Unit. This makes no sense as my older unit was Rev. 1.07. If I can't somehow update the firmware I will send it back and try my luck purchasing one from Kensington.
customer_reviews.author: orytek

customer_reviews.title: The Latest & Greatest Trackball From Kensington!!!
customer_reviews.text: Started using Kensington trackballs since the Turbo Mouse, then all of the various 4.0, 5.0, etc., Expert Mouse versions. This SlimBlade is the nicest one so far. A bit pricey, but the pair that I got for my wife & myself are working flawlessly. The only downside is that you need to clean the fuzz off of the tiny little balls in the base that the trackball rides on every once in a while. Other than that, we love 'em! P.S. Billiard balls no longer work as trackball replacements!
customer_reviews.author: Darrin-in-HB

customer_reviews.title: Big ball and easy to carry. Happy with it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I was looking for a trackball with the biggest ball. From this ball size and bigger is hard to find them, specially to carry around with your laptop. The increased size of the ball makes it very responsive and easy to manipulate. I run it in Windows and Linux. The configuration software allows to personalize just the way you want (on Windows). But had no issues either ok XFCE. I use it with DAW and animation software, where the extra size ball is handy.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Quiros

customer_reviews.title: Buttons much too firm. Spinning ball scroll is very cool.
customer_reviews.text: As a long time user of the Kensington Expert Mouse, I liked the idea of the Slimblade, especially with the spinning ball scroll (as the Expert Mouse scroll was often too tight or eventually too mushy), but I found that after weeks of using it, my thumb was getting very sore. so much so I had to stop using it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Scott

customer_reviews.title: great comfort and control! but the full size is better...
customer_reviews.text: if you are new to this design, it takes a couple days to get used to it, but i love the control, the comfort and the new scroll design. The cord is a little short for my big desk, so I had to get a usb extension, but that would never take away from the overall product. however, I also had the full size version of this mouse, where the scroll is an actual wheel on the outside of the ball. I felt that was better control than this - additionally, the rollers on this version are a bit less smooth.... I will be buying the previous version soon....
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: Excellence
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many many trackballs. This is the best overall design. I love rotating the ball to scroll, or if I really want to get into dedicated scrolling mode, I set the ball itself to scroll the page. I write code for a living, and this helps me fly through files and projects. The 4 buttons (plus 2 more 'buttons' from pressing 2 of the 4 at the same time) are very programmable on Mac. I have one of them set to mission control, and that makes flying around my desktop a breeze. I tried the CST option alongside this one. That is actually an inferior product with good stealth marketing.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy trackball
customer_reviews.text: The trackball is about a centimeter smaller than an pool 8 ball. Very responsive. Like a normal pointing device; I was able to adjust the speed of it. It's much easier on my hand for extended use than a normal mouse. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: C. BRAY

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a regular mouse for 20 years. I gave this a shot due to an upgrade to my home Music Studio. It arrived in great condition, looks amazing, feels amazing but not having the control to move your wrist/hand around feels like you're hands are boxed/trapped just staying at the same spot. (NOT FOR ME) The ball is accurate and smooth. It's pretty big though and takes up space but in the advertisement image on Amazon it doesn't seem that way. Returned it... 🛩 🖥Mouse for me !
customer_reviews.author: Rezwan Khan

customer_reviews.title: Great trackball with quality issues
customer_reviews.text: In terms of ergonomics and functionality, this is my favorite trackball I have tried so far. Rotating the ball for scrolling seems odd at first, but is surprisingly intuitive and easy to do. Unfortunately, I would not have expected there to be this many quality issues. The first unit had buttons that would get stuck occasionally. The second unit I have been using now is making squeaky noises when rolling the ball. The noises can be mitigated by carefully cleaning the contact points, but usually re-appear after less than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: A nice trackball.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better trackballs with a large sized ball and 4 buttons. Alas it has not figured out a way to eliminate the bane of all trackballs - small contaminants especially little fuzzy ones cause it to fail miserably until cleaned out.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Mulwitz

customer_reviews.title: software to program buttins doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: downloaded software but it doesn't work to program the upper two buttons. tried everything. their tech support is horrible. all I really wanted was to use them as forward and back buttons while in a browser. it's a deal breaker. back it goes. seems nice otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Josh.0

customer_reviews.title: This has a nice feal
customer_reviews.text: I use this for work and While there is an adjustment period to it. I like it. Scrolling has been the hardest part for me but that is coming. Good accuracy sensitivity and smooth action make this a very nice device to use.
customer_reviews.author: E. Zelda Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Not Ergonomically Correct
customer_reviews.text: From an ergonomic standpoint, the SlimBlade gets a failing grade. The main reason I purchased it was to alleviate wrist/hand discomfort. I wanted a device that would not cause strain on my wrist and feel comfortable while using it, but this device did not help toward that goal. Perhaps other factors played a role in my unsatisfactory outcome, but I’d caution potential buyers planning on purchasing the SlimBlade expecting to relieve wrist/hand discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: GGUSC04

customer_reviews.title: Even better than the previous kensington trackball
customer_reviews.text: I've used kensington trackballs for over 10 years - probably bought 5 or 6 of them for my home + office over the years. This one is even better - same great ball, but prettier, and feels more robust and dirt resistant. also using the ball lateral rotation as a scroll ring is very smart, as the traditional scroll ring would get dirty, etc...
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Skinta

customer_reviews.title: Hardware revision issue (affects chording)
customer_reviews.text: After working with tech support, it has been discovered that there may be hardware issues preventing the chording options being available in Trackballworks software. Hardware v 1.09 works fine but I've had three versions of v1.00 where these options are simply not present in the software. I should mention I'm on Win 10 (1709). Not sure if this affects other PC OS versions or perhaps MacOS. That being said, support has been positive overall and I have been well taken care of and expect complete resolution at some point in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Eggehorn

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse i've ever owned ... By far!
customer_reviews.text: Best mouse i've ever owned. I have used a roller mouse like this one for the last 10 years, but this one is much better. i like the "heaviness" of the ball. I feel more in control and it's super comfortable because the ball is much bigger than the last one. It's a little more expensive than you would think it should be, but after using it for about 3 months now, I'd pay 2x the cost. If you like this style of mouse...I'd highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Better then original Expert Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Liked everything but the lack of rotation ring below the ball. Little hard to scroll pages because I find the pointer has a will of it's own, causing a stop and repositioning of pointer to scroll. The new software is very helpful to improve the scroll by choosing mouse's button 4 and setting it to scroll. Improves ability to have absolute control of the process. My suggestion is to alter the software to allow a multiplicity of lines to scroll in one click of button! Programmers seeing the importance of this update would see better reviews by the public. My review would have had zero cons! Otherwise it's a well designed.
customer_reviews.author: wsturg

customer_reviews.title: This is a great trackball, I love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trackball, I love it. I much prefer trackballs to mice, for many reasons, and I prefer trackballs operated by fingers rather than thumb--thumbs are not as resilient or precise I find. It operates extremely smoothly and precisely, one can alter speed of movement and clicks, function of buttons, etc. Scrolling is done by rotating the ball, a movement that takes a bit if getting used to and is not my ideal, but works OK. I know that with time this will seem effortless to me, so I do not take off a star.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Payne

customer_reviews.title: Dive in balls' deep!
customer_reviews.text: After using a Kensington Expert Mouse for a better part of a decade, I was hesitant to switch to the SlimBlade due to the lack of a physical scroll ring. I had nothing to worry about. The twisting of the ball to scroll is second nature almost immediately. Placing your finger in the groove next to the ball allows you to scroll effortlessly. The SlimBlade includes a tactile click that only triggers when scrolling. The lower angle required of my wrist to reach the ball compared to the Expert Mouse was also very welcome. I would recommend this to all trackball users.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Yon

customer_reviews.title: SMOOOOOTTHH!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of Kensington products, but this guy takes the cake!! Every operation is so smooth and precise, it's like mousing on a buttered cloud being eaten by a baby angel!! And of course, being able to program the secondary buttons for various tasks is super helpful!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Dreyer

customer_reviews.title: Get yours today!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent trackball!!! After I installed the software/driver for the trackball, it has excellent smooth scrolling. Nice big ball, for my big hands. It does take some time to get use to it, but once you get used to it, it is really great. I have carpal tunnel and it has really helped me out. I do a lot of editing for audio production, and it is really easy on the wrist. With the software from Kensington, Trackball Works, I was able to get smooth motion and customize the four buttons. It works great on my Macbook Pro.
customer_reviews.author: RealFuzion

customer_reviews.title: There is no better mouse on the market
customer_reviews.text: There is no better mouse on the market. I do web and other digital design work and this mouse is simply the best. It's easy and comfortable to use for long periods of time. Once you use it, it just feels like the natural way to mouse. I have used them for years and forgotten about them until I saw it on Amazon recently. I'm glad I did because as soon as I saw it, I bought it. It's been around for as long as I can remember, which is saying a lot in this age of disposable "fashionable" tech. Kensington got it right with this bad boy.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Best trackball available
customer_reviews.text: Working well for me. I really like twisting to scroll, much better than the ribbed ring on Kensington's other models. Clicking noise when scrolling is nice, and not too loud, although I work in a very quiet office and wish I could control the volume somewhat. Currently there is no way. The top two buttons occasionally "catch", meaning that when pressed near the gap, there is a slight catch where the button sticks on something. I notice that when I press more in the center of the button, this does not occur. It's occasionally bothersome.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Oppermann

customer_reviews.title: Good, but I think it's old hardware.
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a 5-star review IF I believed this product was made in the last 5 years... I like the mouse, but I found that the support is very limited and the URLs provided in the box don't work. It seems like Kensington quit making this a long time ago, and I wish I would have known that prior to ordering and paying this much for, essentially, antiquated computer hardware. All that aside, It functions very well, and if you're looking for a trackball mouse with a large ball, this is perfect. I like it for some applications, but it sits right next to my Logitech G9 Laser mouse since it wasn't full-function enough to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Turk

customer_reviews.title: Convenience, comfort and precision in one.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a freak of nature, I admit it. I have always preferred trackballs to traditional mice. They can be much more accurate and stable when performing CAD work, or gaming, for starters, and take up very little desktop real estate. I have one on each PC in the house, and even my elderly mother has been a trackball convert since the late 90s.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kensington Quality Trackball
customer_reviews.text: It's still my favorite track ball design. I've gotten used to the scrolling feature which is now accomplished by turning the trackball like a water faucet. I had the previous version of this track ball that had the scroll ring. So this took a couple of days to get used to it. My biggest disappointment is the software. MouseWorks did so much more. But it's now incompatible with the new Mac OSX so we unless you stay with the older OS (Snow Leopard or earlier) you will loose most of the extras that came with MouseWorks. So really I'd give the track ball 5 stars and the software 2 stars which averages out to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sible

customer_reviews.title: Finally found a trackball that is comfortable for me!
customer_reviews.text: I tried 3 trackballs before giving the Slimblade a shot: Logitech M570 Wireless Trackball Logitech Trackman Marble Mouse Kensington K72337US Orbit Trackball I found all 3 of them uncomfortable to use. The shape and angle of those trackballs put my hand in an awkward, cramped position. I finally tried the Slimblade and find it exceptional. 1) The slim (and more flat) form factor is super comfortable for me. 2) The large trackball allows for more precision (I can use my fingers and thumb together when I need precise movements). 3) The TrackballWorks software lets me customize the buttons that lets me navigate super quickly. If you're interested in trying out trackballs, you should definitely give this one a shot!
customer_reviews.author: CCL

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far. I've had three Microsoft Trackball Explorers over the last 18 years or so that I loved but no longer available so tried a Logitech M570 and it lasted maybe a year. Never did really like the M570 because of the smaller size. The SlimBlade is more the size I like and hopefully it will last a long time. The SlimBlade was very easy for me to get use to and I also like the looks of it. I would recommend the SlimBlade if you like trackballs.
customer_reviews.author: duke

customer_reviews.title: They are not a good company.
customer_reviews.text: This is a shiny rip-off. It died within a few months. No abuse, and no accidents. Just a lousy internal processing component. Kensington should be ashamed. They are not a good company. Rick
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Previous version is better
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. Be better with the scroll wheel of previous version
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Kensington fan forever...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Kensington Trackball. I have used them since the 1990's when I discovered I tend to develop Carpal tunnel syndrome using a mouse. The design has improved over the years. The current slimblade is an excellent design. I actually wore one out in about 5 years of daily use. One of the ruby bearings cracked the housing after accidentally I dropped the thing on the floor one afternoon. They do tend to collect gunk around the ruby bearings... But it very easy to lift out the ball and wipe of the little rubies with your finger and it's good as new again. I love these Kensington Slimblade trackballs!
customer_reviews.author: Buyer51

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomics with Style!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect ergonomic design. I got this trackball because my fingers, wrists, and shoulder were getting really sore. I do a lot of mouse work even though I’m not a graphic designer. I like the weight of the trackball. It has sufficient inertial mass that I have good precision of the mouse pointer.
customer_reviews.author: Manfred Ju

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Slim as it is, it still needs a wrist wrest, and it is not super high resolution. That said, it's a nice trackball for the money, I hope it lasts. The rotate the ball to scroll feature is handy and intuitive after a short time. Buttons feel a little cheap, but it's not a $150+ unit either, so. All in all I'm pretty pleased, I've been using a Logitech Trackman Marble for a decade or more(many of them), and I think this might be a decent replacement. It better last longer than a Trackman does for the money though.
customer_reviews.author: Tiberious

customer_reviews.title: Tends to forget how to move horizontally
customer_reviews.text: I like Kensington trackballs but I've noticed that the horizontal axis "locks up" sometimes. I don't think I'd buy it again. After a year the button are sticking and the axis problem still continues, support only replies with canned responses.
customer_reviews.author: OldMrPossum

customer_reviews.title: Still the best
customer_reviews.text: My favorite trackball by a mile. Keep it clean! I do wish it was either more flat or had a way to elevate the front edge. It encourages keeping your wrist pinned down which isn't great ergonomics. Otherwise it's the bomb.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Owens

customer_reviews.title: Amazing trackball, beats the expert mouse hands down.
customer_reviews.text: I was debating over this product or the. In the end I decided to get both and compare. This product is everything about the expert mouse, but improved upon. The buttons have a huge hit area on this mouse, they're easier to click, they make less noise. I was uneasy about spinning the trackball to scroll, but Kensington did a fantastic job implementing this functionality. The ball makes little clicking noises when you're scrolling, so you know what to expect, and I have yet to scroll when I wanted to move or vice versa. The software is simple but robust, with lots of great settings. I have absolutely no complaints with this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: mafcho

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for Logitech Optical TrackMan
customer_reviews.text: I do like the Kensington Slimblade Trackball. Initially I was going to return it because I saw nothing that gave scrolling ability. Then my son told me that twisting the ball clockwise or counterclockwise accomplishes that. That feature is not as straightforward as the scroll wheel on a mouse, but it works fairly well. My only objection to the unit now is that sometimes I press too far down on the side that produces a left-click, and nothing happens. I probably can cure that by programming the back side of that quadrant to also produce a left-click.
customer_reviews.author: P. George

customer_reviews.title: This has replaced the mouse I was using at work.
customer_reviews.text: It basically works like a trackball should, and the twist-to-scroll feature is very intuitive - it's like twisting a volume knob. The control panel applet works nicely. Hardware companies generally struggle to write usable software, so that was a nice surprise. I was able to remap the buttons with no trouble. I'd give it five stars if there was a bit less stiction - fine positioning is good enough, but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Delaminator

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: Big footprint, easy to use, compared to my Logitech tracball this is just as easy to use. Ball is larger and easier to manipulate
customer_reviews.author: DynaBro

customer_reviews.title: I'm getting another.
customer_reviews.text: After my beloved Logitech Cordless Optical Trackman's left mouse button died after 10 years of abuse, and with nothing acceptable from Logitech, I found the SlimBlade. The SlimBlade exceeds my expectations. Very comfortable, and I love the feel of the trackball- it just glides. It's more precise than I am, which is all you can ask for from an input device. I love the twist to scroll function, and the buttons feel great. Bottom line: I'm getting another. Maybe more.
customer_reviews.author: Pariah Zero

customer_reviews.title: Kensington track ball
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works great in my video editing software as well in my games. Been using a track ball for years. And this one is by far the best. Thanks Kensington for a top notch product.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Smooth
customer_reviews.text: Great trackball. No problem with scrolling. Works extremely well. Trackball Works handles Protools edit functions well. Not all functions are programmable in set up list but enough of them do and make it worthwhile.. Really comfy and no wrist pain for my average size hand.. It is worth the money..
customer_reviews.author: Richard A DeLuca

customer_reviews.title: Best trackball mouse of them  all!
customer_reviews.text: Super fast and pinpoint accurate, very useful and intuitive extra buttons configuration. Feels great, extra smooth and very easy to get used to. It occupies less space than the one you'll need with a conventional mouse. I use it with a Mac ... so bye bye Mighty Mouse... Very highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even better than the Expert Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Over the years, the Expert Mouse has been the standard for a reliable and durable trackball. While they are pricey, they last forever (I got 12 years out of one), and provide an accuracy and ergonomic edge that a regular mouse just can't seem to achieve with me. Even though this is $20 more than the Expert Mouse, I decided to give it a shot, and wow am I glad I did. The mouse is even more comfortable than the Expert Mouse, and the rotating ball to scroll is even better than the scroll ring. It also sits at a slightly flatter angle than the Expert Mouse, which accounts for its comfort.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, smooth motion
customer_reviews.text: I've used this trackball for my Mac. It works very well. The ball is heavy and solid, so the motion is smooth and accurate. The ability to scroll up and down by rotating the ball rather than using a ring is a design feature (that I'm not describing very well). I do have to clean debris from the inside periodically, like every other track ball I've used since my 1992 PowerBook, but it's a small inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ramm

customer_reviews.title: Scrolling Is Brilliant Yet Unergonomic
customer_reviews.text: I have really mixed feelings about this trackball. I loved my time with it, and it is easily my favorite trackball, but a blown capacitor ended up ending our relationship prematurely. I might have replaced it with another of the same, but Amazon was sold out. And, more importantly, I was starting to have arm pain from using the scrolling feature. Twisting the ball to scroll is a really clever idea, and it's very satisfying to do, but it is hard on your wrist. You have to make an unnatural twisting motion with the wrist while your fingers are pointing downward and gripping the ball. If, like me, you got a trackball for the ergonomics, this may be a deal-breaker.
customer_reviews.author: John Bruce

customer_reviews.title: 5 star function 1 star quality control
customer_reviews.text: Came with a contact error that needed instant disassembly. I had parts flying around inside and a cable was making a short, disabling (luckily not burning) USB hub. That is 1 star Function and form and usability is an absolute 5 star. Until I installed Yosemite OS X, after which I lost extra functionality completely. No new driver, works as a 2 button/scroller trackball now. Looks like an engineer had a great design, then marketing cut cost until they ended up with a cheap enough production.
customer_reviews.author: denesK

customer_reviews.title: Ball as Scroll Wheel?
customer_reviews.text: Maybe people need the precision more, but I don't like turning the ball as a scroll wheel, too slow. I still prefer the Kensington Expert Wireless Trackball Mouse. 4 stars, nothing wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: mark leykamp

customer_reviews.title: ... using this for the past few months and it's nice. It feels more solid and is easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for the past few months and it's nice. It feels more solid and is easy to clean. Takes a bit of getting used to but most functions work well. Scrolling wants to make the pointer shoot off in random directions and jump and jiggle around and is generally no match for the scroll ring on their cheaper Kensington Orbit it replaced, though. Still if you want a trackball this one or the Kensington Expert are about as good as it gets anymore.
customer_reviews.author: H. D.

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Expert Mouse trackball for many years. The SlimBlade is even more comfortable and the addition of scroll (with sound effects even!) is just functionally amazing. I am really happy I got it.
customer_reviews.author: mike rosing

customer_reviews.title: Best trackball available
customer_reviews.text: I have the other version of the trackball the Expert Mouse. This is even better. I love the spinning of the wheel to scroll. My only problem occurs when I go back to my office and start spinning the trackball on the Expert Mouse and no scrolling occurs. (Have to use the ring on the Expert.) I have read reviews complaining about the software but I am not sure I understand the complaints. The software is completely customizable. Buy this mouse, you will never want another one. It rocks!
customer_reviews.author: BladeDoc

customer_reviews.title: This is as good as it gets
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased Kensington products for more than a decade, including every version of trackball mice they produced. This is as good as it gets. I will never understand using a normal mouse on a computer. A trackball is much better to use. The SlimBlade is the best. Scrolling with the ball took some getting used to, but it is now second hand.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Anthony Reis

customer_reviews.title: Simply, A Great Trackball!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned just about every trackball Kensington made. When I wanted upgrade my wife's office, I felt it was time to upgrade her Expert trackball to the Slimblade. My wife complements on how smooth this ball moves and I like how I did not have to change drivers for the new trackball. It was plug and play easy!! In my opinion, Kensington make the best trackballs ever. I will always be a fan!!
customer_reviews.author: LaVell Finerson

customer_reviews.title: Plug-n-play. Better than the original
customer_reviews.text: Spinning the ball to scroll works well and places less strain on my hand than did the scroll ring on the original trackball. The ball cavity is open at the bottom, so should reduce "gunk" from accumulating inside.
customer_reviews.author: Curious

customer_reviews.title: ... using this trackball for a few months not and LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this trackball for a few months not and LOVE IT!!!. Really works well and feels good in the hand. I love the scroll function. The button are large and easy to find and use. If I had one negative comment is that the whole thing is very slick, I would like to see some type of slight texture so the ball doesn't feel so slippery in your hand. Other than that well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: John Elder

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and eliminates wrist/hand issues for me
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for about 8 months. It completely eliminated issues with wrist and finger numbness. I get more precise control than any of the various mice I have used. The big ball operates very smoothly. I also like the ability to use the Kensington software to program the four buttons for custom functions. I programmed one of the buttons to perform double-click and love it. I am using it with a Macbook Pro and it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: W. R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: I find this incredibly annoying. Otherwise
customer_reviews.text: I've noticed that the actuation force across the button zones has ceased being uniform fairly quickly. I find this incredibly annoying. Otherwise, good product but the software is mediocre.
customer_reviews.author: Chet Manly

customer_reviews.title: Incredible mouse.
customer_reviews.text: The greatest mouse I've ever used. I don't feel any wrist fatigue, it's beautifully designed. The four programable buttons help to make workflows more productive. Simply awesome. I am not a gamer, but I don't see why it couldn't also perform well in that context. From my experiences with graphic desig, photo and video editing applications, this trackball is simply excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Libni Garcia

customer_reviews.title: love this mouse
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse for working in documents. I have to do a lot of scrolling, and years of using a scroll wheel on a conventional mouse have actually given me arthritis in my middle finger. With this mouse you just twist your wrist or spin your hand in a natural motion. To navigate you move your fingers but not your whole arm. Brilliant. There is a bit of a learning curve, and the first week of use is slow and not fun, but it's smooth sailing after that. The only thing that keeps it from 5 stars is that it is just stupidly expensive.
customer_reviews.author: B. Simons

customer_reviews.title: i fail, 1 winner
customer_reviews.text: I prefer trackball mice and especially Kensington; for me, nothing is comparable.
customer_reviews.author: ekf

customer_reviews.title: The Kensington Expert is much better. The SlimBlade has REALLY BAD contacts for the ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Kensington SlimBlade and a Kensington Expert trackball at the same time. The Kensington Expert is much better. The SlimBlade has REALLY BAD contacts for the mouse ball to rest on, just little metal pins that don't even stick out of the plastic. The ball just makes contact with the base and is hard to move and won't spin. This is the worst trackball I've ever used, and I've used them since before optical trackballs existed. Get the Expert or go with another brand, this trackball is awful
customer_reviews.author: ranix

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Compact
customer_reviews.text: The Kensington SlimBlade kinda sorta fits between the halves of my split keyboard. I had to widen their placement angle a degree or two, but that is still well within the comfort zone.
customer_reviews.author: A. MacLeod

customer_reviews.title: Great Trackball Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews on the Kensington Slimblade Trackball, and some didn't like it because the buttons could not be programmed. I downloaded and installed the software on my Windows 7 box, and it now has the ability to program buttons. The software is simple and unobtrusive, and it works. I have been using the mouse for about 2 weeks now, and I am happy with it. The scrolling seems natural, though rarely it scrolls when I'm trying to move the cursor. I've been a fan of Kensington and Microsoft trackballs for many years, and this is the best I've owned to date.
customer_reviews.author: C.N.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to use over long hours of use.
customer_reviews.text: I review large amounts of written material on computer, often for more than eight hours a day. The Scroll feature makes review of large documents much easier than touch screen or touch pad.
customer_reviews.author: Willard K.

customer_reviews.title: Best trackball
customer_reviews.text: This is the best trackball that I've used. I have always used Kensington trackballs but the slim design makes it easier to use with less wrist strain.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Provost

customer_reviews.title: I love this mouse - I'm an editor and always keep ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse - I'm an editor and always keep a spare one in the closest in case my mouse dies. Thr one downside is they manage to get dirty fairly quick and need a wipe down inside...if you let it go too long it'll get crusty and the mouse becomes a paper weight (hence the spare I always have on hand) still haven't found a mouse that beats it in terms of functionality and comfort
customer_reviews.author: Jon Lipman

customer_reviews.title: I would order from you any day of the week.
customer_reviews.text: mouse works exactly like I thought it would. It did not take very long to get to me and was in excellent condition. I have not had a single hook up with it and I use it everyday. I have no hand Mobility and if not able to use a regular mouse so the trackball was a lifesaver. I used to get frustrated trying to use my regular mouse and it ended up I just stopped using my computer. after I got my trackball I am on my computer every day being able to do my school work as well as having fun listening to music or downloading.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative to traditional mouse
customer_reviews.text: After working in a profession that requires heavy keyboard and mouse use, I opted to purchase the Kensington Slimblade. Admittedly, I did balk at the price at first but I gave it a shot nonetheless. I was not disappointed and I would go as far to say it has improved my productivity. I'm using this mouse on Fedora 16 and It worked great out of the box. I notice alot less hand fatigue and although there is a little bit of a break-in period to get used to using a trackball, I feel it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew V

customer_reviews.title: Great trackball, just needs a bit of grease...
customer_reviews.text: The experience of this trackball is great! It is light, very portable, and accurate for all types of design work! The ball does get to be a bit rough to spin sometimes, but all you need to do it wipe the ball on your nose. Yes, NOSE OIL is the answer to a biodegradable, natural lube. Just wipe the ball on either side of your nose, and you will have to smoothest trackball experience. (they are your oils, it is not that "gross") Believe me or not.
customer_reviews.author: Fil

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Good trackball but could use some improvements. The roller is very soothe and precise. When the buttons are pressed instead of a click you hear a cheap plastic sound. Could not get any of the button changes to take place using the TrackballWorks software. Would like to be able to assign keystrokes to the top buttons instead of just the options they allow. The hardware except for the cheap plastic clicking sound is far ahead of Logitech but the software is way behind.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bartee

customer_reviews.title: everithing is better
customer_reviews.text: life is just easier now it feels like all my lifetime i been using the wrong mouse
customer_reviews.author: piston

customer_reviews.title: Your other mice will be super jealous.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a huge fan of trackball mice, but with my new music studio computer and its enormous 4K display, I needed to cover a lot of real estate with precision and ease. This is definitely getting the job done. Occasionally I have to pull up the red ball and clean some detritus off, but that's stupidly easy to do. This mouse is cool, slick, and really great at what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Crates

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the mouse because it would not scroll on the screen properly. The mouse pointer on the screen would only move strictly in a horizontal perimeter. I believe mine was a bad one. Returning it was a pain. I know it is a good mouse if it works though.
customer_reviews.author: Colt

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It's not for everyone, in fact my wife hates it compared to a regular wireless mouse but I absolutely love it. Takes some getting used to but once you are it's a blast spinning that ball around.
customer_reviews.author: gost

product_meta.title: Kensington SlimBlade Trackball Mouse (K72327U)
product_meta.description: Size:One SizeWant to improve your productivity, increase cursor control and save desktop space? Look no further than a trackball from Kensington-the world leader in trackball innovation. All Kensington Trackballs can be fully customized with Kensington TrackballWorks software to customize the functions of each of the buttons found on Kensington trackballs. The result is a more productive and truly personalized computing experience. Set your preferred functions or keyboard shortcuts for each trackball button or combination of buttons, adjust the pointer speed and acceleration and do so much more. Best of all, by allowing you to personalize your trackball experience, TrackballWorks makes your trackball work the way you do.

Laser tracking delivers precision cursor control
Free downloadable KensingtonWorks software provides button customization
Compatible with Windows (including Windows 8) and macOS
